instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Charging Battery Symbol - Not Booting Properly
threads.message:
Hello,

With and without the battery connected, I get the 20v on charger and a charging battery symbol on the screen, but does nothing else.

Plugged in charger, I get 20v 0.75-1.2 amps for 25-30 seconds
[LIST]
[*]This is with the board alone on the desk
[*]After 25-30 seconds, it will go to 20v 0 amps until I have to replug the charger or trigger SMC_ONOFF__L
[/LIST]

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.6v
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> = 0v when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is triggered
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> pulses when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is triggered
[LIST]
[*]stays on for 25-30 seconds along with <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL>
[*]<SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> = 0.733 volts goes to 0.600 volts after 15 seconds or so then to 0 volts after 25-30 seconds
[*]If connected to a display, it will show a charging battery symbol on the screen
[/LIST]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Charging Battery Symbol - Not Booting Properly
threads.message:
Do you get charging, or low battery level logo?
I suppose SMC believes the battery is low and shutsdown.

Check what happens booting in SMC bypass mode.
Be sure to use original 87W charger.
